message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL. 

The paper proposes a new neural architecture for recommendation with reviews, which involves representation learning and matching of reviews in a word-by-word fashion. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories related to natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML) such as Information Retrieval (cs.IR), Computational Linguistics (cs.CL), Machine Learning (cs.LG), Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), and Deep Learning (cs.DL). Among these, cs.IR and cs.CL are the most likely categories as they directly relate to the use of reviews for recommendation and the matching of reviews at a word-level. However, the paper also involves the use of neural networks and co-attention mechanisms, which are common in ML and DL research, hence these categories are also likely.
